title: Edge case: `st.Page` requires both `title` and `url_path` if given a filename with only underscores (e.g. `_.py`)

labels.name: status:confirmed
labels.description: Bug has been confirmed by the Streamlit team

body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

Definitely a teeny tiny edge case, but when you declare `st.Page("_.py")` the automatic page title and URL pathname fail.

### Reproducible Code Example

```Python
import streamlit as st

st.navigation(
    st.Page("a.py")
    st.Page("_.py")
)
```


### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create the entrypoint file and additional pages (`a.py` and `_.py`, can be empty).
2. Run the app and look at navigation

### Expected Behavior

Since the automatic page title and URL path are insufficient, I'd expect an error.

### Current Behavior

Since the file `_.py` has a filename consisting entirely of underscores, there is no number and no "name" of the page parsed from the filename by MPAv1 standardards. This means there is no page title and it will not show up in navigation.

Furthermore, if you add a `title`, it will show up in navigation, but the automatic URL path will be "" which won't work (unless this page also happens to be the default page).

Therefore:
- If the file is named with all underscores and not the default page, both `title` and `url_path` are needed.
- If the file is named with all underscores and is the default page, at least `title` is needed.

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: v1.35.1.dev20240609
- Python version: 3.11
- Operating System: Mac
- Browser: Chrome


### Additional Information

_No response_
